StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Clonal Hematopoeisis of Indeterminate Potential and Risk of Autopsy-defined Sudden Cardiac Death

Person.Organization: J. DAVID GLADSTONE INSTITUTESUNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA, SAN FRANCISCO

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: This work was supported by grant 1R01HL157247-01A1 to Dr. Zian Tseng from the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI), a part of the National Institutes of Health (NIH). For publications, written, and/or oral presentations resulting from use of this data, please cite the following information: “The original data description for "Clonal Hematopoeisis of Indeterminate Potential and Risk of Autopsy-defined Sudden Cardiac Death" can be found here: (Journal Citation __________)(PMID __________). The original data used for the analysis in this publication can be found in the NIH database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) under the accession number phs______.”
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of the data must be related to Sudden Cardiac Death. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Only full or expedited approvals are acceptable, and an ANNUAL IRB review is required base on the informed consents from the submitting institution. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Requestor must provide a letter of collaboration with the primary study investigator(s).

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)
